item.title: [HBASE-1588] Rig our build to support our new contribs -- stargate and THBase/ITHBase
item.description: Jigger our build so it will pass targets across all in the contrib. subdirectories. Will model it on hadoop parent way of calling into contrib dirs (Did work on that making it work for hbase when it was a hadoop contrib).
item.summary: Rig our build to support our new contribs -- stargate and THBase/ITHBase

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Add build of src/contrib/transactional as proof that this rigging works.

I committed stargate into contrib/stargate.

Do:

ant compile compile-test

cd contrib

ant compile compile-test

ant test -Dtestcase=Test00MiniCluster

For some inexplicable reason the cluster shuts down before the test completes. ("Cluster shutdown requested.") This does not happen when I test the self contained dist up on github.
Fixed the problem. The zoo.cfg in src/test wasn't being picked up and had an incorrect client port number.

Just committed fixup to make package and javadoc targets work for contribs.

Package will build up the jar and war and then install them into package hbase under contrib/$

{name}

dir.

Changed name of produced jars to be hbase-$

{version}transactional.... and hbase${version}

-stargate.

I'm going to leave this alone now for a while.

Andrew, you probably want some start/stop script going on, do you? Or will it be ./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.stargate.SomeMainClass start/stop? You need to get a bit of package level doc. going too 'cos at moment it looks bare. We need to also add in deprecations of the old REST and point folks at the new.

Clint needs to do a bit of packaging up too.

I can help out....

Will leave this issue open till stargate and transactional properly packaged: i.e. they build into right place, have all support they need in terms of conf and start/stop script support, old references are deprecated, and docs are in place.
Build braking on hudson because of clover. Added to src/contrib/build-contrib.xml clover handling. Lets see if it fixes it up on hudson.

@Andrew

So, for me I'm seeing stargate tests fail because of jaxb complaints. My guess the issue is something like whats described here: http://weblogs.java.net/blog/ramapulavarthi/archive/2007/01/problems_using.html If I don an ant test and provide a command-line arg. of "-Djava.endorsed.dirs=lib/java.endorsed.dir " (after moving the jaxb into a subdir in lib named java.endorsed.dir) all runs better... all pass but TestCellSetModel.

If you agree issue is above, I'll work on fixing using this java.endorsed.dir stuff.
Looks like transactional unit tests are failing. Looking into this too.
Disabling the call to src/contrib tests for the moment till we resolve above.

Committed fix to TestRowResource test case that was failing for Stack.

Filling in Javadoc now.

Now RPC does not work for the transactional interface. I see thinks like:

@Clint. Openend HBASE-1669
This is what I did to allow outside code to add interfaces to HBaseRPC
I enabled contrib-tests as part of the general build not both stargate and transactional hbase are passing again.

Clint, I also added to our main 'Getting Started' pointers to the THBase and ITHBase package doc. I notice that the ITHBase is pretty sketchy. Any chance of your filling it in some. Also check the THBase doc. I'd like to point fellas here when they come hunting THBase/ITHBase. Good stuff.
Clint, I also added a README to the top of your contrib package pointing users at the package documentation.

So, I'm going to close this issue. Basic infrastructure is in place.

Clint, if you can clean up doc., then I think your contrib is good to go – assuming THBase and ITHBase basically work. Open new issue to get any doc. committed Clint. Thanks.
